forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 4pm. Sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West northwest wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 42. North northwest wind 7 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As the afternoon sun makes a tentative appearance, Downtown San Francisco experiences a gentle interlude between stormy skies and the shimmering promise of clearer days. The temperature is on the cusp of a cool 55 degrees, sinking slowly to 53 as the day matures. A mere whisper of rain lingers in the hours before four, cast aside by the feeble sunlight overhead. Despite the vigorous wind from the northwest, the city is mostly clear, with the familiar embrace of the marine layer retreating, leaving the horizon free of fog and inviting exploration.

Tonight, expect a restful blanket of clarity, the sky wide and unobstructed as the temperature drops towards a refreshing 42 degrees. The north-northwest wind carries a refreshing chill, reminding you of the evening's quiet promise. Dressing in layers is wise—a light jacket will keep the cool air at bay, revealing the warmth nestled beneath. As dusk sets in, a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero or an intimate evening at a cozy café will provide respite from the day's cool embrace. There is beauty in the simple moments today brings, so savor them.
